canonical_explanation.text: Transport helps us move from one place to another. There are three types of transport: land transport (car, bus, train), water transport (boat, ship), and air transport (aeroplane, helicopter). We see many vehicles on Indian roads like auto-rickshaws, bicycles, buses, and scooters. We must follow road safety rules to stay safe.
rules: Transport means moving people and things from one place to another.
Land transport moves on roads and rails: car, bus, train, bicycle, auto-rickshaw.
Water transport moves on water: boat, ship, ferry.
Air transport flies in the sky: aeroplane, helicopter.
We should follow road safety rules: look left and right, use zebra crossing, wear a seatbelt.
Traffic lights tell us when to stop (red), get ready (yellow), and go (green).

questions.question_text: Which of these is a land transport?
questions.explanation_correct: A bus is a land transport. It moves on roads and carries many people from one place to another.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A boat and ship move on water, and an aeroplane flies in the air. A bus is a land transport that moves on roads.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a water transport?
questions.explanation_correct: A boat is a water transport. It moves on rivers, lakes, and seas carrying people and things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A car, train, and bicycle all move on land. A boat is a water transport that moves on water.

questions.question_text: Which of these is an air transport?
questions.explanation_correct: An aeroplane is an air transport. It flies in the sky and can carry many people to faraway places very fast.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bus and auto-rickshaw move on roads, and a ship moves on water. An aeroplane is an air transport that flies in the sky.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle is very common on Indian roads and has three wheels?
questions.explanation_correct: An auto-rickshaw has three wheels and is very common on Indian roads. It is a popular way to travel short distances in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A car has four wheels, a bus has many wheels, and a train runs on rails. The auto-rickshaw has three wheels and is seen everywhere in India.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle runs on railway tracks?
questions.explanation_correct: A train runs on railway tracks. Trains carry many people and goods over long distances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Buses, cars, and bicycles run on roads. A train is the vehicle that runs on railway tracks.

questions.question_text: What does a RED traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A red traffic light means STOP. We must stop and wait until the light turns green before crossing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red does not mean go or go faster. A red traffic light always means STOP. We wait for the green light to go.

questions.question_text: What does a GREEN traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A green traffic light means GO. When the light is green, vehicles and people can move forward safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Green does not mean stop or wait. A green traffic light means GO — it is safe to cross or move forward.

questions.question_text: What should we do before crossing the road?
questions.explanation_correct: We should look left and right before crossing the road. This helps us see if any vehicle is coming so we can cross safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Closing eyes, talking on the phone, or playing on the road is very dangerous. Always look left and right before crossing.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle do we ride by pedalling with our feet?
questions.explanation_correct: We ride a bicycle by pedalling with our feet. A bicycle has two wheels and does not need petrol or diesel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, buses, and aeroplanes have engines. A bicycle is the vehicle we ride by pedalling with our feet.

questions.question_text: How many types of transport are there?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 3 types of transport: land transport, water transport, and air transport.
questions.explanation_incorrect: There are not 1, 2, or 5 types. There are exactly 3 types of transport: land, water, and air transport.

questions.question_text: A ship is a type of water transport.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A ship is a water transport. It is a big vessel that moves on the sea and carries people and goods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. A ship moves on water, so it is a type of water transport.

questions.question_text: An aeroplane moves on water.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. An aeroplane flies in the air, not on water. Boats and ships move on water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Aeroplanes fly in the sky. They are air transport, not water transport.

questions.question_text: Ramu lives in a village. He uses an animal to pull his cart. What is this cart called?
questions.explanation_correct: This is a bullock cart. Bullocks (oxen) pull the cart. Bullock carts are still used in many Indian villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Auto-rickshaws have engines, buses are big vehicles, and bicycles have pedals. A cart pulled by bullocks is called a bullock cart.

questions.question_text: Priya wants to go from India to America very quickly. Which transport should she use?
questions.explanation_correct: Priya should take an aeroplane. Aeroplanes fly very fast and can reach faraway countries like America quickly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Buses, bicycles, and auto-rickshaws travel on roads and cannot cross oceans. An aeroplane is the fastest way to go to America.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle carries many passengers in a city and stops at bus stops?
questions.explanation_correct: A bus carries many passengers and stops at bus stops. People wait at bus stops and get on the bus to travel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bicycles, cars, and scooters carry fewer people. A bus is a big vehicle that stops at bus stops and carries many passengers.

questions.question_text: Where should we cross the road?

options.text: In the middle of the road

questions.explanation_correct: We should cross the road at the zebra crossing. The zebra crossing has black and white stripes and is the safest place to cross.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Crossing anywhere, in the middle of the road, or behind a bus is dangerous. We should always use the zebra crossing.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle has two wheels and an engine, and is smaller than a car?
questions.explanation_correct: A scooter has two wheels and an engine. It is smaller than a car and is a very common vehicle on Indian roads.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bus is big, a train runs on tracks, and a ship moves on water. A scooter is a two-wheeled vehicle with an engine.

questions.question_text: Fishermen go to the sea to catch fish. Which transport do they use?
questions.explanation_correct: Fishermen use a boat to go to the sea and catch fish. Boats can float on water and move through it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Buses, trains, and bicycles travel on land. Fishermen use boats to go into the sea and catch fish.

questions.question_text: What should we wear when riding in a car?
questions.explanation_correct: We should wear a seatbelt when riding in a car. A seatbelt keeps us safe if the car suddenly stops or has an accident.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hats, sunglasses, and gloves are not safety items for car travel. A seatbelt is the important safety item we must wear in a car.

questions.question_text: Which of these vehicles can fly?
questions.explanation_correct: A helicopter can fly. Helicopters have big spinning blades on top and can fly up, down, and even hover in one place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars and buses move on roads, and boats move on water. A helicopter is a vehicle that can fly in the air.

questions.question_text: It is safe to play on the road.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. It is NOT safe to play on the road. Vehicles pass by on roads and we can get hurt. We should play in a park or playground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Playing on the road is very dangerous because vehicles move on roads. We should play in parks or playgrounds.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle carries heavy goods from one city to another on roads?
questions.explanation_correct: A truck carries heavy goods from one city to another. Trucks are big vehicles with large storage space for goods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bicycles and scooters are small, and auto-rickshaws carry passengers. A truck is the big vehicle that carries heavy goods on roads.

questions.question_text: Anu wants to cross the road. The traffic light is red. What should she do?
questions.explanation_correct: Anu should wait for the green light. A red traffic light means STOP. She should wait until the light turns green to cross safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running across or crossing with eyes closed is very dangerous. When the traffic light is red, we must wait for it to turn green.

questions.question_text: A family wants to cross a river. There is no bridge. What transport can they use?
questions.explanation_correct: The family can use a boat to cross the river. Boats float on water and can carry people across rivers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Buses, cars, and bicycles cannot travel on water without a bridge. A boat is the right transport to cross a river.

questions.question_text: What colour is a typical school bus in India?
questions.explanation_correct: School buses in India are typically yellow. The bright yellow colour makes them easy to see on the road.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While buses can be many colours, school buses in India are usually yellow so they can be easily seen and recognized.

questions.question_text: What does a YELLOW traffic light mean?

options.text: Get ready, the light is about to change

questions.explanation_correct: A yellow traffic light means get ready. The light is about to change — either from green to red (slow down) or from red to green (get ready to go).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Yellow does not mean go fast or turn around. A yellow light means get ready because the signal is about to change.

questions.question_text: A bicycle needs petrol to run.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A bicycle does not need petrol. We pedal a bicycle with our feet to make it move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. Bicycles run on human effort — we pedal them with our feet. They do not need any fuel.

questions.question_text: Which list has ONLY land transport?
questions.explanation_correct: Car, bus, and train are all land transport. They all move on roads or rails on land.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Boat and ship are water transport, and aeroplane is air transport. Only the list car, bus, train has only land transport.

questions.question_text: In a village, which of these vehicles might you see most?
questions.explanation_correct: In an Indian village, you would most likely see a bullock cart. Villages often have bullock carts, bicycles, and tractors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aeroplanes fly in the sky, ships are on the sea, and metro trains are in big cities. In villages, bullock carts are very common.

questions.question_text: Where should we walk on the road?

options.text: In the middle of the road
On the wrong side of the road

questions.explanation_correct: We should walk on the footpath (sidewalk). The footpath is made for people to walk safely, away from vehicles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walking in the middle of the road, behind a truck, or on the wrong side is dangerous. We should always walk on the footpath.

questions.question_text: Which transport would you use to travel from Delhi to Mumbai very fast?
questions.explanation_correct: An aeroplane is the fastest way to travel from Delhi to Mumbai. It takes only about 2 hours by plane.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bicycles and bullock carts are very slow, and a boat cannot go between these cities. An aeroplane is the fastest transport for long distances.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle is used by ambulances to take sick people to the hospital quickly?
questions.explanation_correct: An ambulance van is used to take sick people to the hospital quickly. It has a siren and flashing lights so other vehicles make way.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bicycles and bullock carts are too slow, and boats travel on water. An ambulance van rushes sick people to the hospital.

questions.question_text: We should always wear a helmet when riding a bicycle or scooter.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Wearing a helmet protects our head if we fall. It is very important to wear a helmet when riding a bicycle or scooter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. A helmet protects our head from injury, so we should always wear one when riding.

questions.question_text: Which group shows water transport only?
questions.explanation_correct: Boat, ship, and ferry are all water transport. They all move on water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, trains, and bicycles are land transport. Aeroplanes and helicopters are air transport. Only boat, ship, and ferry are all water transport.

questions.question_text: Rahul sees a vehicle on the road with a siren going 'wee-oo wee-oo'. It has a red cross on it. What vehicle is it?
questions.explanation_correct: It is an ambulance. An ambulance has a siren and a red cross symbol. It rushes sick people to the hospital.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A school bus is yellow, a fire engine is red, and a police van has a blue light. A vehicle with a siren and red cross is an ambulance.

questions.question_text: A child is leaning out of a moving bus window. Is this safe?

options.text: Yes, if the bus is slow

questions.explanation_correct: No, leaning out of a moving bus window is very dangerous. The child could fall or get hit by something. We should sit properly inside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaning out of a bus window is never safe, no matter how slow the bus is. We should always sit properly inside the bus.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the biggest vehicle?
questions.explanation_correct: A train is the biggest vehicle among these. Trains have many coaches and can carry hundreds of people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bicycles, scooters, and auto-rickshaws are all small vehicles. A train is much bigger and carries many more people.

questions.question_text: Meena wants to go to an island. There is water all around the island. How can she get there?
questions.explanation_correct: Meena can go to the island by boat or aeroplane. Since the island is surrounded by water, only water or air transport can reach it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, buses, and bicycles need roads and cannot travel on water. To reach an island, Meena needs a boat or an aeroplane.

questions.question_text: A helicopter is a type of air transport.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A helicopter flies in the air, so it is a type of air transport. It can take off and land without a runway.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. Helicopters fly in the air just like aeroplanes, so they are air transport.

questions.question_text: Which road safety rule is WRONG?

options.text: Look left and right before crossing

questions.explanation_correct: Playing cricket on the road is WRONG and dangerous. We should play in a park or playground, not on the road where vehicles pass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Looking left-right, using the zebra crossing, and walking on the footpath are all correct safety rules. Playing on the road is wrong and dangerous.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle does NOT need an engine?
questions.explanation_correct: A bicycle does not need an engine. We use our legs to pedal a bicycle. Cars, buses, and scooters all have engines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cars, buses, and scooters all have engines that run on fuel. A bicycle runs on human power — we pedal it with our legs.

questions.question_text: Which transport is the FASTEST?
questions.explanation_correct: An aeroplane is the fastest transport. It flies very fast through the sky and can travel long distances in a short time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bullock carts, bicycles, and buses are much slower. An aeroplane is the fastest way to travel.

questions.question_text: You hear an ambulance siren behind your car. What should your car do?

options.text: Stop in the middle of the road
Move to the side and let the ambulance pass

questions.explanation_correct: The car should move to the side and let the ambulance pass. Ambulances carry sick people and need to reach the hospital fast.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Driving faster or honking is wrong. We should always move aside and give way to ambulances because they carry sick people.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle would you see at a railway station?
questions.explanation_correct: You would see a train at a railway station. Trains arrive and depart from railway stations carrying passengers and goods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ships and boats are at ports, and aeroplanes are at airports. At a railway station, you would see trains.

questions.question_text: It is okay to cross the road when the traffic light is red for pedestrians.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. We should NOT cross when the light is red. Red means stop. We must wait for the green signal to cross safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is false. A red light means stop. Crossing during a red light is very dangerous. Always wait for green.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a vehicle?
questions.explanation_correct: A chair is NOT a vehicle. A chair is a piece of furniture we sit on. Buses, cars, and trains are all vehicles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Buses, cars, and trains are all vehicles that carry people. A chair is furniture, not a vehicle.

questions.question_text: Where does an aeroplane take off and land?
questions.explanation_correct: An aeroplane takes off and lands at an airport. Airports have long runways for planes to take off and land safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Railway stations are for trains, bus stands for buses, and ports for ships. Aeroplanes use airports.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the safest way to travel on a busy road?

options.text: Walk on the footpath and cross at the zebra crossing
Walk in the middle of the road
Cross from behind a parked bus

questions.explanation_correct: Walking on the footpath and crossing at the zebra crossing is the safest way. This keeps us away from vehicles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running, walking in the middle, or crossing from behind a bus is dangerous. The safest way is footpath and zebra crossing.

questions.question_text: Which vehicle do we see at a harbour or port?
questions.explanation_correct: We see ships at a harbour or port. Ships come to ports to load and unload passengers and goods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trains are at stations, buses at bus stops, and bicycles on roads. Ships are found at harbours or ports.

questions.question_text: Why do we have traffic lights on roads?

options.text: To help vehicles and people move safely

questions.explanation_correct: Traffic lights help vehicles and people move safely. They tell us when to stop, get ready, and go so there are no accidents.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Traffic lights are not for decoration or play. They are important safety devices that help vehicles and people move safely on roads.
